snippet: Brian Hernandez Jr. and a colt named Fort Larned upset the best jockey in the United States, Mike Smith, and the race favorite Mucho Macho Man at the Breeders’ Cup on Saturday.
abstract: Brian Hernandez Jr, riding a colt named Fort Larned, wins the Breeders’ Cup Classic, upsetting veteran jockey Mike Smith and race favorite Mucho Macho Man.
lead_paragraph: Brian Hernandez Jr. and a colt named Fort Larned upset the best jockey in the United States, Mike Smith, and the race favorite Mucho Macho Man at the Breeders’ Cup on Saturday.

headline.seo: Fort Larned and Hernandez Jr. Upset Favorite at Breeders’ Cup
headline.main: A Fresh but Dusty Face Rules the Breeders’ Cup
headline.print_headline: A Fresh but Dusty Face Rules the Breeders’ Cup
